name: palm date production, conditioned and dried, organic | palm date, conditioned and dried, organic | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/15795/documentation

This dataset represents 1 kg of organic palm date fruit conditioned and dried in Tunisia. All the exchanges are calculated per kg of palm date and are based on field data from the main industrial palm date exporter in Tunisia. The inventory includes the following activities: sorting, washing, freezing, cooling, heating, drying. The packaging has not been taking into account.Regarding waste management, palm date kernel are recovered as animal feed. The conditioning of the organic palm date is different from the conditioning of conventional palm date. The fumigation is replaced by the freezing (4 hours under -20 Â°C) of the dates and there is no glucosing. The annual productivity of the plant is 13000 tons of palm dates Deglet Noor ( 3% of the palm dates are organic.). The cultivar of the dates studies is Deglet Noor. Tunisia is the world's largest exporter of Deglet Noor.

The activity starts when palm date fruit arrives to the plant in order to be conditioned. 

The activity ends when the fruit has undergone all processing steps. The palm date is then ready to  be packed and send to the importing country. The facility, the infrastructures and the machineries has not been taking into account.
category: C:Manufacturing/10:Manufacture of food products/103:Processing and preserving of fruit and vegetables/1030:Processing and preserving of fruit and vegetables

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The inventory is an extrapolation modeled for Tunisia and is based on field data from one of the main exporter of the Country. Tunisia is the world's largest exporter of Deglet Noor. The conditioning takes place in a plant located in Beni Khalled (in northern tunisia).
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: The main palm date conditioning is located in the north of Tunisia. The value were collected from one of the main exporter of Deglet Noor in Tunisia (13'000 tons each year, 3% are organic palm date). It has been validated and complemented by literature data.

flow.name: palm date, conditioned and dried, organic
flow.category: C:Manufacturing/10:Manufacture of food products/103:Processing and preserving of fruit and vegetables/1030:Processing and preserving of fruit and vegetables

exchanges.description: 1.234 kg of palm date from the farm is conditioned to produce 1 kg of palm date conditioned and dried. 0.120 kg becomes organic waste (who is recovered for animal feed) and 0.114 kg is the amount of water that is lost during the drying process

flow.name: palm date, organic

exchanges.description: Represent the amount of electricity needed for the conditioning of the palm dates. It includs the fumigating, the cooling, the drying, the heating and the washing of the fruits. More electricity is needed for organic palm because they are freezed, unlike the conventional palm dates that are fumigated.
